sense.def:
To hold something
pomeni nekaj nesti ali podpreti, navadno s prsti ali rokami.

seg.quote: He was holding a bottle of milk.
I held the picture up to the light.
He held her in his arms.

sense.def:
To take hold of something
pomeni dati roko tesno okoli nečesa.

seg.quote: She took hold of my wrist.
He still had hold of my jacket.
She resumed her hold on the rope.

gramGrp.pos:
VB
with
OBJ
or
REFL VB

sense.def:
To hold one's body or part of one's body
pomeni ohraniti telo ali del telesa v določenem položaju.

seg.quote: Etta held her head back.
Mrs Patel held herself erect.

sense.def:
Kadar neka stvar
holds another thing
, drži drugo stvar v pravilnem položaju.

seg.quote: There was just a rail holding it.
The glue held.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
holds a particular amount of something
, lahko vsebuje določeno količino nečesa.

seg.quote: The theatre itself can hold only a limited number of people.

gramGrp.pos:
VB
with
OBJ
or
VB
with
OBJ
and
OBJ

sense.def:
To hold someone
pomeni nekoga imeti zaprtega v ječi.

seg.quote: I was held overnight in a cell.
The young private had been held a prisoner by the guerrillas.

sense.def:
To hold power or office
pomeni imeti oblast ali uradni položaj.

seg.quote: The reins of power are held by a restricted group of Shi’ite clergy.
...one of the greatest Prime Ministers who ever held office.

sense.def:
To have a hold over someone
pomeni imeti oblast ali nadzor nad nekom.

seg.quote: The party tightened its hold on the union.
The farmer had a hold over me. He had discovered my illegal whiskey still.

sense.def:
To hold a qualification, licence or other official document
pomeni imeti kvalifikacije, dovoljenje ali kako drugo uradno listino.

seg.quote: You need to hold a work permit.
She held a BA degree in psychology.

sense.def:
To hold an event
pomeni organizirati neki dogodek in ga izpeljati.

seg.quote: He had promised he would hold elections in June.

sense.def:
To hold a conversation with someone
pomeni z nekom se pogovarjati.

Z izrazom
hold
lahko povemo, da je nekaj določene kakovosti ali ima določene značilnosti.

seg.quote: These legends hold a romantic fascination for many Japanese.
We will have to see what the future holds.

sense.def:
To hold a particular opinion
pomeni biti določenega mnenja.

seg.quote: People who hold this view are sometimes dismissed as cranks.
Marxists hold that people are all naturally creative.

sense.def:
Kadar nas med telefoniranjem nekdo prosi
to hold the line
, hoče, naj počakamo, da nas bodo prevezali.

seg.quote: The line's engaged; will you hold?

sense.def:
To hold someone's interest or attention
pomeni poskrbeti, da se nekdo še naprej zanima za nas.

Če neka ponudba ali vabilo
still holds
, sta še vedno veljavna.

seg.quote: Will you tell her the offer still holds?

sense.def:
One's luck holds
ali
the weather holds
rečemo, kadar sreča ali vreme ostaneta lepa.

seg.quote: If my luck continues to hold, I think I've got a fair chance.

sense.def:
The hold of a ship or aeroplane
je prostor na ladji ali v letalu, kjer je spravljen tovor.

To hold tight
pomeni nekaj zelo trdno držati.

Kadar nekaj
takes hold
, začne imeti velik učinek.

seg.quote: Then the fire took hold.

sense.def:
To get hold of something or someone
pomeni uspeti nekoga dobiti ali najti.

seg.quote: Can you get hold of a car this weekend?

sense.def:
Hold it
ali
hold everything
rečemo, kadar želimo nekomu povedati, naj neha delati tisto, kar dela.

To hold one's own
pomeni, da nas nasprotnik ne premaga, ker smo mu kos.

seg.quote: She was still able to hold her own with the Prime Minister.

sense.def:
Izraz
to hold something against someone
uporabimo, kadar nekdo stori nekaj slabega in zaradi tega z njim ravnamo strožje.

seg.quote: His refusal to cooperate will be held against him.

sense.def:
To hold back
pomeni obotavljati se, preden nekaj storimo.

seg.quote: Police have held back from going into such a holy place.

sense.def:
To hold someone or something back
pomeni preprečiti, da bi nekdo napredoval ali bi se nekaj povečalo.

seg.quote: If she is ambitious, don't try to hold her back.
The rise in living standards has been held back for so long.

sense.def:
To hold something back
pomeni nekomu ne povedati vseh podrobnosti o nečem.

seg.quote: I want the truth now, with nothing held back.

sense.def:
To hold down a job
pomeni uspeti obdržati službo.

seg.quote: He was surprised to find her holding down a successful job in high finance.

sense.def:
To hold something off
pomeni preprečiti, da bi nas nekaj doseglo.

seg.quote: The French and British wanted to hold off Portuguese textile competition.

sense.def:
To hold on
pomeni nekaj čvrsto držati v roki.

seg.quote: He tried to pull free but she held on tight.

sense.def:
To ask someone to hold on
pomeni nekoga prositi, naj kratek čas počaka.

seg.quote: Hold on a moment, please.

sense.def:
To hold onto something
pomeni nekaj čvrsto držati z roko.

seg.quote: He has to hold onto something to steady himself.

sense.def:
To hold onto something
pomeni tudi nekaj obdržati in ne izgubiti.

seg.quote: Politicians want to hold on to power at all costs.

sense.def:
To hold out one's hand or something that is in your hand
pomeni stegniti roko ali tisto, kar imamo v roki, proti nekomu.

seg.quote: ‘John?’ Esther held out the phone.

sense.def:
To hold out
pomeni trdno stati in se uspešno upirati nasprotnikom.

seg.quote: Women all over the country are holding out for more freedom.
I can't hold out forever.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo ali nekaj
holds someone up
, povzroči, da ima ta oseba zamudo.

seg.quote: The whole thing was held up about half an hour.

sense.def:
Not to hold with something
pomeni nečesa ne odobravati.

seg.quote: ...a man who did not hold with these notions.
